interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Room 222: Season Two [DVD]
Review Date: 2012/11/25
Store: Lloyd Haynes  (Actor),     Denise Nicholas  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, TV
Product Description: ["A compelling series about life at a multiracial Los Angeles high school, Room 222 left an indelible mark on popular culture by using the half-hour form to explore socially relevant issues (more than a year before Norman Lear's other groundbreaking shows—All in the Family and Maude) and by starting the still-popular trend of high school television series. Created by the now-legendary James L. Brooks (The Mary Tyler Moore Show, Rhoda, The Simpsons), the program was praised for dealing realistically with such subjects as racism, sexism, illiteracy, guns in school and drugs. Pete Dixon (Lloyd Haynes) is a dedicated and popular history teacher who fights the good fight on the side of his students. Joining him in his idealistic approach to education are guidance counselor Liz McIntyre (Denise Nicholas) and student teacher Alice Johnson (Karen Valentine). Experienced and slightly world-weary principal Seymour Kaufman (Michael Constantine) provides a balance to the youthful idealism of the '60s cultural revolution—but at the end of the day, everyone is on the side of the students. Season Two guest stars include Richard Dreyfuss, Kurt Russell, Cindy Williams, Chuck Norris, Tim Matheson and Ed Begley, Jr.", ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama/Television, Television', 'Format': 'Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Lloyd Haynes, James L. Brooks, Michael Constantine, Karen Valentine, Denise Nicholas', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Runtime': '10 hours and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'DSF11387D', 'Media Format': 'Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '10 hours and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 28, 2020', 'Actors': 'Lloyd Haynes, Denise Nicholas, Michael Constantine, Karen Valentine', 'Studio': 'SHOUT! FACTORY', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Great show... a far cry from the predicable cookie cutter scrips of contemporary drama. It's interesting to view the students or rather the actors portraying the students' feelings of anxiety and despair in the society i.e., the assassinations, the riots, conscription  and how their views mirrored the militant/counter culture groups of that time period (e.g., The Black Panthers; The Weather Underground; Brothers of Internal Love, FLQ). And to watch the following actors in the early stages of their careers and how skinny they were was comical:  i.e. , Teri Garr; Glynn Turman- A Different World, The Wire; Rob Riener; Cindy Williams--Lavern and Shirley; Ed Bagley Jr. and Kurt Russell.
Review Title: What Memories of the Turbulent late 1960's
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Mystery Science Theater 3000 - Mitchell
Ashby, John  (Actor),     Baker, Joe Don  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Comedy
['Rare Mystery Science theater 3000 episode where Joel and the bots riff on the awful film "Mitchell" starring Joe Don Baker']
{'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '8 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 20, 2001', 'Actors': 'Ashby, John, Baker, Joe Don, Balsam, Martin, Barnes, Rayford, Bass, Todd', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Studio': 'Rhino Theatrical', 'Number of discs': '1'}
It's obvious  that "Mitchell" was a copy of the Shaft movie and short-lived television series: his own man; rebel within law enforcement while sticking it to the man;sex machine (sort of); and willing to take changes regardless of the odds. BUT the cast of MST3000 rip it to shreds.  With the exception of Gypsy (extremely annoying), the cast has some good one liners: "Mr Treveno has been hit again" ; "he just landed just short of the green"; "fresh panties all around"; and  Tom Servo's obsession with Joe Don Baker's eating/farting. One of the best!!!
Yes One of the Best

profile:
**User Preferences Summary:**

- **Genres:** Maintains a strong preference for comedy within science fiction and fantasy, but also expresses appreciation for classic dramas that raise socially relevant issues, especially those viewed through a nostalgic lens.
- **Entertainment Style:** Continues to enjoy humor derived from satire and commentary, with a specific interest in shows that diverge from contemporary predictable scripts, highlighting engaging character dynamics and timelines relevant to significant historical events.
- **Content Appreciation:** Values clever one-liners and insightful character interactions, indicating a consistent preference for dialogue-driven narratives that blend humor with serious themes. 
- **Media Format:** Prefers physical media, particularly DVDs, reflecting a passion for collecting tangible formats that allow an exploration of both comedy and classic television.
- **Community Engagement:** Participates in discussions or reviews about films and television, revealing a desire to connect with others over both nostalgic and impactful storytelling.
- **Specific Interests:** Shows an interest in cult classic films and series that provide ironic or parody-driven content, while also gravitating towards groundbreaking series that tackle timely societal issues.

Overall, this user exemplifies a passionate fan of comedic narratives, balancing an affection for classic media formats while enjoying thought-provoking content that resonates with historical contexts and presenting poignant social commentaries.
